titlestmt.subtitle: Papers of Gertraude Krueger at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-05-14 05:20:36 -0400.

change.item: Batch update to change subject links.

did.abstract: The Krueger mss., 1988-1993, consist of translations from English into German of literary works by British authors Julian Barnes and William Boyd. The translator is Gertraude Krueger of Berlin and the translations were published by Haffmans Verlag in Zurich in the case of Barnes and by Rowohlt Verlag in Hamburg for Boyd.
did.langmaterial: Materials are in English and German.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Gertraude Krueger, of Berlin, translated works by British authors Julian Barnes and William Boyd and works by American author Valerie Wilson Wesley from English into German.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Krueger mss., 1988-1993, consist of translations from English into German of literary works by British authors Julian Barnes and William Boyd. The translator is Gertraude Krueger of Berlin and the translations were published by Haffmans Verlag in Zurich in the case of Barnes and by Rowohlt Verlag in Hamburg for Boyd.

Additions to the Krueger mss., 1995-1996, are first draft translations into German of two books by American author Valerie Wilson Wesley: When Death Comes Stealing (New York: G.P. Putnam's Sons, 1994) and Devil's Gonna Get Him (New York: G.P. Putnam's Sons, 1995). The former was published as Ein Engel über deinem Grab (Zurich: Diogenes Verlag, 1996); the latter as In Teufels Küche (Zurich: Diogenes Verlag, 1998). Both manuscripts are accompanied by photocopies of correspondence from Krueger to her editor at Diogenes Verlag as well as notes and queries regarding appropriate translations of words and phrases.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Prior arrangements are not necessary before coming to the Library, however, patrons from out of town are encouraged to communicate with the Library in advance of their visits to ascertain availability of materials.
Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Curator of Manuscripts, Lilly Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Krueger mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of queries to Barnes, with his answers, 7p.
Photocopies of correspondence between Krueger and her editor at Haffmans Verlag about the translation, 4p.
Preparatory notes, 13p.
Two earlier drafts of pages 73-78, 15p.
Other notes and queries, 9p.

did.unittitle: Barnes, Julian.Staring at the Sun. (London: Jonathan Cape, ).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of Krueger's queries to Barnes, with his answers, Nov. 1990-Mar. 1991 [6]p.
Holograph preparatory notes, mostly re: terminology [25]p.
Acknowledgements, 1p.

did.unittitle: First draft translation into German with numerous revisions and changes in pencil and some in ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Fragen an William Boyd zu Brazzaville Beach," 1p.
Holograph preparatory notes, 11p.
Clippings from German newspapers, etc. with certain words or phrases marked.

did.unittitle: Wesley, Valerie Wilson.When Death Comes Stealing (New York: G.P. Putnam's Sons, ).
First draft translation in German with numerous revisions and changes in pencil. Dated on last page.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copies of correspondence
Notes and queries to German colleagues and American friends
Notes on conversation with publisher's reader
Notes on brand names
Newspaper article from Der Tagesspiegel, 12 November 1995, on marijuana.

did.unittitle: Wesley, Valerie Wilson.Devil's Gonna Get Him (New York: G.P. Putnam's Sons, ).
First draft translation in German with frequent revisions and changes in pencil.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copies of correspondence, notes and queries of German and American colleagues
Questions and suggestions by Judge Hartmut Fischer
Questions and suggestions by physician Caroline Einkämpl.
